content.description: Stand start at the base of the slab in front of the small roof like feature, move straight up through that small roof onto the slab, continue straight on up using crimps and some crack holds to an easy walk off topout.
content.protection: Realistically 4+ pads and spotters, unless you intend to solo the climb.
content.location: On the Redeemer boulder, to the left, and up the hill, from the start of Redeemer. Can be accessed by walking to the Streambed boulder, walking up the hill and around the back of Redeemer, passing Quartz Blade.

content.description: Just behind the Last Call boulder is a tall pointy boulder with a prominent arete on the front. Follow this arete up through about 10 feet of V0-ish bouldering to an easier slab finish. Finish with confidence, since a fall from the upper slab would probably send you crunching into the sharp upper edge of a smaller boulder leaning against the side of this one.
content.location: In the talus field just uphill from Last Call.

content.description: Stand start at the crack at the bottom of the low angle slab near the left arete of this face, move straight on up using small edges and good feet all the way up the slab to an easy walk off topout.
content.location: Left side of the Redeemer slab, left of Redeemer roof and up the hill 20' or so from the start of Redeemer.

content.description: Sit start on left facing quartz-y block with large feet below you. Pull on and move up the arete using a series of large left facing sidepull jugs; as you get higher up, holds on the arete become more helpful. Topout straight over the start of the climb using good edges and crack holds, with a variety of foot options.
content.protection: 2-3 pads, be careful of the landing being ~two tiered.
content.location: On the upper portion of the Redeemer boulder, just up and right from where the start of Redeemer is. Can be accessed by walking up and around the Redeemer boulder to the left, passing Redeemer Roof and Reclamation day, or by going to the Streambed boulder and walking up behind that directly to where Quartz Blade is.

content.description: Just behind Last Call sits Redeemer, a 20' tall slab with a not 100% flat landing area. There are several other problems on the boulder on the other shorter faces, the landings are not perfect on any of them, but the climbing is interesting and worth a try if you have enough pads.
